'Cangjie programming language_enum_option_option_type_definition': 'In Cangjie code language, The Option type in Cangjie is defined as a generic enum with two constructors: Some(T) and None. The Some constructor carries a value of type T, indicating the presence of a value, while None indicates the absence of a value. The Option type is used to represent a value that may or may not be present.
When T is instantiated into different types, different Option types will be obtained, such as Option<Int64>, Option, <String>etc.'

Code_Example:
enum Option<T> {
    | Some(T)
    | None
}

'Cangjie programming language_enum_option_option_type_none': 'In Cangjie code language, When the context does not explicitly specify the type, None cannot be used directly to construct an Option<T> value. Instead, the type must be specified explicitly using None<T>.'

Code_Example:
let a = None<Int64> // a: Option<Int64>
let b = None<Bool> // b: Option<Bool>
